create.name: Privilege
create.description: You have advantage on rolls you make to consort with nobles, negotiate prices, or leverage your reputation to get what you want.

create.name: Well-Read
create.description: You have advantage on rolls regarding the history, culture, or politics of a prominent person or place.

create.name: Dedicated
create.description: Record three sayings or values your upbringing instilled in you. Once per short rest, when you describe how you’re embodying one of these principles through your current action, you can roll a d20 as your Hope Die instead of a d12.

create.name: Steady
create.description: You have advantage on rolls to traverse dangerous cliffs and ledges, navigate harsh environments, and use your survival knowledge. Additionally, gain an Armor Slot at character creation.

create.name: Know The Tide
create.description: You can sense the ebb and flow of life. When you roll with Fear, put a token on this card. You can hold a number of tokens up to your level. Before you make an action roll, you can spend one or more of these tokens to add them as +1 modifiers to your roll. At the end of a session, clear all unused tokens.

create.name: Scoundrel
create.description: You have advantage on rolls to negotiate with criminals, detect lies, or find a safe place to hide.

create.name: Low-Light Living
create.description: When you are in an area with low light or heavy shadow, you have advantage on rolls to hide, investigate, or perceive details within that area.

create.name: Nomadic Pack
create.description: Add a Nomadic Pack to your inventory. Once per session, you can spend a Hope to reach into this pack and pull out a common item that is useful to the situation. Work with the GM to figure out what this item is.

create.name: Lightfoot
create.description: Your movement is naturally silent. You have advantage on rolls to move without being heard.

create.name: Purposeful Design
create.description: Decide who you were created by and for what purpose. Choose an experience you have that reflects this and increase it by +1.

create.name: Efficient
create.description: When you take a short rest, you can substitute a long rest move for one of your short rest moves.

create.name: Elemental Breath
create.description: Choose an element for your breath (ice, fire, electricity, etc.). You can use this breath against a target or group of targets within Very Close range, treating it as an Instinct weapon that deals d8 magic damage using your Proficiency.

create.name: Scales
create.description: Your natural scales act as protection, increasing your Armor Score by +1.

create.name: Increased Fortitude
create.description: You can spend 3 Hope to halve incoming physical damage.

create.name: Thick Skin
create.description: When taking minor damage, roll 1d6. On a 5+, you take no damage instead.

create.name: Quick Reactions
create.description: You can mark a Stress to take advantage on a Reaction Roll.

create.name: Celestial Trance
create.description: During a rest, you can drop into a trance and make an extra downtime move.

create.name: Wings
create.description: You can fly. While flying, mark a Stress before an adversary’s attack roll to increase your Evasion by +2 against that attack.

create.name: Luckbender
create.description: Once per session, after you or an ally in Close range make an Action Roll, you can spend 3 Hope to reroll the Duality Dice. You must take the new result.

create.name: Leap
create.description: You can easily leap up to Close range across gaps or chasms without making an Agility roll.

create.name: Kick
create.description: On a successful melee attack, you can mark a Stress to kick yourself off of the target, adding 2d6 to the damage and pushing either them or yourself out of Melee range.

create.name: Natural Calm
create.description: Whenever you should mark a Stress, roll a d6. On a result of 6, don’t mark it.

create.name: Charge
create.description: When you succeed on an Agility roll to move from Far or Very Far range into Melee with one or more targets, mark a Stress to deal 1d12 physical damage to all targets.

create.name: Fungril Network
create.description: You can make an Instinct Roll (12) to speak with others of your ancestry across any distance using your mycelial array.

create.name: Death Connection
create.description: While touching a corpse that died recently, you can mark a Stress to extract one memory related to a specific emotion or sensation.

create.name: Shell of Protection
create.description: Your shell provides a natural shield. Add your Proficiency to your armor score.

create.name: Slow and Steady
create.description: During combat, you can make an attack roll with advantage by placing an additional token on the action tracker.

create.name: Endurance
create.description: Gain an additional Hit Point slot at character creation.

create.name: Reach
create.description: Treat any weapon, feature, ability, or spell that has Melee range as though it has Very Close range instead.

create.name: Danger Sense
create.description: Once per short rest, mark a Stress to make an adversary reroll an attack against you or an ally within Very Close range of you.

create.name: Surefooted
create.description: You ignore disadvantage on Agility rolls.

create.name: Youthful Spirit
create.description: At the beginning of each session, give everyone in your party a Hope.

create.name: Little Lucky
create.description: When you roll a 1 on your Hope die, you can reroll it, and must take the new result.

create.name: High Stamina
create.description: Take an additional Stress slot at character creation.

create.name: Adaptability
create.description: When you fail a roll that utilized one of your Experiences, you can mark a Stress to reroll. You must take the new result.

create.name: Fearless
create.description: When you roll with Fear, you can mark 2 Stress to make it a roll with Hope instead.

create.name: Dread Visage
create.description: You have advantage on rolls to intimidate a hostile target.

create.name: Feline Instincts
create.description: When you make an Agility roll, you can mark a Stress to reroll your Hope Die. You must take the new result.

create.name: Retracting Claws
create.description: You can make an Agility roll to scratch a target in Melee range. On a success, they become Vulnerable.

create.name: Sturdy
create.description: When you have one hit point remaining, your armor score is doubled.

create.name: Tusks
create.description: After making a successful Melee attack, you can spend a Hope to also gore the target with your tusks, adding +1d6 to the damage roll.

create.name: Long Tongue:
create.description: You can use your long tongue to grab onto things Close to you. You can also mark a Stress to unleash it as a Finesse Close weapon that does d12 physical damage using your Proficiency.

create.name: Amphibious
create.description: You can breathe and move underwater just as easily as on land.

create.name: Nimble
create.description: Increase your Evasion by +1 at character creation.

create.name: Natural Climber
create.description: You have advantage on Agility rolls that involve balancing and climbing.

class.name: Bard

create.name: bard's hope
create.description: When you or an ally Close to you makes a Presence roll and either succeeds with Fear or fails, spend three Hope to negate that roll’s consequences by intervening.

create.name: Rally
create.description: Once per session as your party prepares to enter a dangerous or difficult situation, describe how you rally them and give yourself and each of your allies a d6 Rally die. Anyone with a Rally die can spend it to roll it, adding the result to an action roll, reaction roll, or damage roll, or clearing Stress equal to the Rally die result. At the end of each session, all unspent Rally dice are cleared. The Rally die you distribute increases to 1d8 at level 5.

create.name: Heart of a Poet
create.description: When speaking to a person you're trying to impress, persuade, or offend, you can spend Hope and add 1d4 to the action roll against them.

create.name: Rousing Speech
create.description: Once per long rest, you can use an action to give a heartfelt, inspiring speech. All allies who can hear you clear two Stress.
You know your moving words can boost the morale of the group. Once per session, when you use your skills as a linguist to encourage or exhort an ally, you can do one of the following:
effects: Allow them to find a mundane object or tool they need.
Help an Ally without spending Hope.
Give them an additional downtime move during a rest.

create.description: The Rally die you distribute increases to a d10. In addition, whenever you Help an Ally, if you narrate the moment as if you were writing the tale of their heroism in a memoir, your advantage die to help them is a d10.
When you take this Foundation, describe what instrument you are practiced in. You can use an action to perform each song once per long rest:
effects: When you play a relaxing song, you and any Close allies heal 1 Hit Point.
When you play an epic song, make a Close target temporarily Vulnerable.
When you play a heartbreaking song, you and any Close allies take a Hope.

create.description: Your rallying songs also help steel the courage of those who listen. Anybody who receives a Rally die from you via your Rally ability can also choose to either gain a Hope or clear a Stress.
Your craft rivals the greats, your skill and creativity unbounded. You can perform each of your Foundation songs an additional time per long rest.

background_questions: Who from your community taught you to have such confidence in yourself?
You were in love once. Who was it with, and how did they hurt you?
You’ve always looked up to another bard. Who are they and why do you idolize them?
connections: What made you realize we were going to be such good friends?
What do I do that annoys you?
Why do you grab my hand at night?

class.name: Druid

create.name: A Small Bag of Rocks & Bones
A Strange Pendant Found in the Dirt
druid's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope while in Beastform to increase your damage thresholds by +3 until you drop the form.

create.name: Wildtouch
create.description: You can perform harmless, subtle effects that involve nature at will. (Ex: causing a flower to rapidly grow, summon a slight gust of wind, start a campfire, etc.)

create.name: Beastform
create.description: Mark a Stress to transform into a magical creature of your level or lower from the Beastform list. While transformed, you can’t use your weapons or cast any spells, but you gain the features, attack trait, and evasion bonus of the creature. You can drop out of this form at any time. When in Beastform, your armor becomes part of your body and you mark armor slots as usual; when you drop out of Beastform, those marked armor slots remain marked. If you mark your last Hit Point or Stress, this form automatically drops.

create.name: Elemental Incarnation
create.description: Mark a Stress to embody an elemental spirit from the list below. The embodiment lasts until you take Severe damage or until your next short rest. This feature can overlap with Beastform.
effects: Fire: When an enemy in melee range deals damage to you, they take 1d10 magic damage.
Earth: You gain +1 to your Armor Score.
Water: When you deal damage to an enemy in Melee range, all other enemies within Very Close range mark a Stress.
Air: You can hover, gaining advantage on Agility rolls.

create.description: Once per short rest, while in Elemental Incarnation, you can assume an elemental aura matching your embodied element. The aura’s effects apply within your Close Range, following you until Elemental Incarnation ends.
effects: Fire: Whenever an enemy marks at least 1 Hit Point, they also mark a Stress.
Earth: Your allies gain +1 to their Armor Score.
Water: After an enemy deals damage to you, you can mark a Stress to move them anywhere within Very Close range.
Air: When you or an ally take damage from an attack beyond Melee range, reduce it by 1d8.

create.description: While in your Elemental Incarnation, you further embody the spirit and gain the following benefit for that element:
effects: Fire: Your Proficiency increases by +1 for attacks and spells that deal damage.
Earth: When you mark an Armor Slot, roll 1d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, clear an Armor Slot.
Water: When you are hit by an attack, you can mark a Stress to make the attacker Vulnerable.
Air: You gain +1 Evasion and can fly.

create.name: Clarity of Nature
create.description: Once per long rest, you may create a space of natural serenity around you. After spending a few minutes resting within the space, you can clear Stress equal to your Instinct trait, distributed as you choose between you and your allies.

create.name: Regeneration
create.description: Use an action and spend 3 Hope to clear 1d4 Hit Points on a creature you are touching.
You can now use Regeneration on a creature within Very Close range, instead of touch.

create.name: Warden's Protection
create.description: Once per long rest, you can use an action to magically repair armor outside of downtime. When you do, you or one ally in your Close Range can clear a number of Armor Slots equal to your Instinct.

Your animal transformation embodies a healing guardian spirit. While you are in Beastform, when an ally within Close Range marks 2 or more Hit Points, you can mark a Stress to reduce the amount of Hit Points they mark by 1.

background_questions: Why was the community you grew up in so reliant on nature and its creatures?
What was the first bond you made with a wild animal? Why did it end?
Who has been trying to hunt you down? What do you think they want from you?
connections: What did you confess to me that makes me leap out into danger for you every time?
What animal do I tell you that you remind me of?
What affectionate nickname have you given me?

class.name: Guardian

create.name: A Stone Totem from Your Mentor
guardian's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope to clear up to three armor slots.

create.name: Unstoppable
create.description: Once per Long Rest, you can choose to become Unstoppable. You gain an Unstoppable die, which begins as a d4. Place it on the spot to the right, starting with the “1” value facing up. Whenever you deal one or more hit points to an adversary, increase the Unstoppable die value by one. When you increase the value above the die’s highest number or when the scene ends, remove the die and drop out of Unstoppable. At Level 3, upgrade your Unstoppable die to a d6. At Level 7, upgrade it to a d8. While Unstoppable, you:
effects: Gain resistance to physical damage.
Increase your current Armor Score by your Proficiency.
Add the current value of your Unstoppable die to your damage dice total.
Cannot be Restrained or Vulnerable.

create.description: When you take this foundation, increase all of your Damage Thresholds by +1.
When you take physical damage, always reduce it by your armor score before applying it to your thresholds. You can still spend armor slots to reduce it further.
When you take this specialization, raise all of your Damage Thresholds by +2.
When a Very Close ally takes damage, you can mark an Armor Slot to reduce the damage by your Armor Score.
When you take this mastery, raise all of your Damage Thresholds by +3.
When an ally within Close range has 2 Hit Points or fewer and should take damage, you can immediately mark a Stress to sprint to their side and take the damage instead.
When you take this Foundation, gain an additional armor slot immediately.
When you are hit by an enemy in melee range, immediately roll a number of d6 equal to the amount of hit points you marked. For each result of 5+, deal a hit point back to the enemy.
When an enemy damages an ally within your Melee range, the next successful attack you make against that enemy has +1 Proficiency.

Spend 2 Hope to prioritize an enemy until your next rest. When you make an Attack Roll against your prioritized enemy, you can switch the values on your Hope and Fear dice. You can only prioritize one enemy at a time.

background_questions: Who from your community did you fail to protect, and why do you still think of them?
You’ve recently been tasked with protecting something important, with the goal of delivering it somewhere dangerous. What is it and where does it need to go?
You consider an aspect of yourself to be a “weakness.” What is it, and how has it affected you?
connections: How did I save your life the first time we met?
What small gift did you give me that you notice I always carry with me?
What lie have you told me about yourself that I absolutely believe?

class.name: Ranger

create.name: A Trophy From Your First Kill
Ranger’s Focus
create.description: Spend Hope and make an attack with your weapon. On a success, you temporarily make that target your Ranger’s Focus, along with doing damage from the attack. Until your Ranger’s Focus ends or you make a different creature your Ranger’s Focus, you gain these benefits:
effects: You know precisely what direction they are in.
All damage rolls you make against them also deal a Stress.
When you miss them with an attack, you can end Ranger’s Focus to reroll your Duality dice and take the new result.

create.name: ranger's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope and increase your Evasion by +1 until your next short rest.
When you take this foundation, increase all of your Damage Thresholds by +1.
When you take physical damage, always reduce it by your armor score before applying it to your thresholds. You can still spend armor slots to reduce it further.
When you take this specialization, raise all of your Damage Thresholds by +2.
When a Very Close ally takes damage, you can mark an Armor Slot to reduce the damage by your Armor Score.
When you take this mastery, raise all of your Damage Thresholds by +3.
When an ally within Close range has 2 Hit Points or fewer and should take damage, you can immediately mark a Stress to sprint to their side and take the damage instead.
You have an animal companion of your choice (at GM's discretion). They always stay next to you unless you tell them otherwise.
Take the Ranger Companion sheet. Whenever you level up your character, also choose a level up option for your companion from this sheet.
When you take this Specialization, gain an additional level-up option for your companion immediately.
When an enemy attacks you while they’re in your companion’s Melee range, you gain +2 Evasion against the attack.
When you take this Specialization, gain 2 level up options for your companion immediately.

Once per long rest, if the damage from an attack would mark your companion’s or your last Hit Point, and you are within each other’s Close range, the other rushes to their side and takes that damage instead.

background_questions: A terrible creature hurt your community, and you’ve vowed to hunt them down. What are they, and what unique trail or sign do they leave behind anywhere they go?
Your first kill almost killed you too. What was it, and what part of you was never the same after this event?
You’ve traveled many dangerous lands, but what is the one place you refuse to go?
connections: What friendly competition do we have?
Why do you act differently when we’re alone than when others are around?
What have you asked me to keep an eye out for, and why are you worried about it?

class.name: Rogue

create.name: Hide
create.description: When you move into a location where no enemies can see you, you can use an action to become Hidden (any rolls against you have disadvantage). As a Rogue, when you are Hidden, targets also can’t see you, even if they move into line of sight. You are no longer Hidden after you move or attack.

create.name: Sneak Attack
create.description: Whenever you make an attack while you are Hidden or while an ally is in Melee with your target, add a d6 to your damage roll. When you use Sneak Attack, you can also spend any number of Hope before the attack roll, then if the attack is successful, also add a number of d6 equal to the Hope spent.

create.name: rogue's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope to increase your Sneak Attack damage. Until your next short rest, you add 3d6 instead of 1d6 to each Sneak Attack damage roll.
When you arrive in a prominent town or environment, you know somebody that calls this place home. Give them a name, note how you think they could be useful, and choose one from the list below:
effects: They owe me a favor, but they will be hard to find.
They’re going to ask for something in exchange.
They’re always in a great deal of trouble.
We used to be together. It’s a long story.
We didn’t part on great terms.

create.description: Once per session, you can briefly call forth a shady contact. Immediately choose one of the benefits below and describe what brought them here to help you in this moment:
effects: They provide 1 handful of gold, a unique tool, or a mundane object that the situation requires.
The next time you make an Action Roll, their help lets you increase either your Hope or Fear die result by 3.
The next time you deal damage, they snipe from the shadows, adding 2d8 to your damage roll.

create.description: You can now use your Specialization Feature three times per session. You can also choose from the following options when you use it:
effects: When you mark at least 1 Hit Point, the contact rushes out to shield you, reducing the Hit Points marked by 1.
When you make a Presence Roll in conversation, they back you up. Your Hope die becomes a d20 for the roll.

create.name: Shadow Stepper
create.description: You can move from shadow to shadow. When you step into the shadow cast by another creature or object, or into an area of darkness, mark a Stress to disappear from where you are and reappear inside of any other shadow within Far range. When you do, you are Hidden.

create.name: Dark Cloud
create.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (15). On a success, create a temporary dark cloud that covers any area within Close range. Anyone in this cloud can’t see outside of it, and anyone outside of it can’t see in. You are considered Hidden from any enemy it blocks line of sight from.

create.name: Adrenaline
create.description: When you are Vulnerable, you always add your Level to your damage roll total.
Your Evasion permanently increases by +1, and you can now use Shadow Stepper to move within Very Far range.

create.name: Cloaked
create.description: At any time, you can mark a Stress to cloak yourself. While cloaked, you gain the benefits of the Hidden condition and automatically lose the Restrained condition if you have it. You stop being cloaked when you roll with Fear or start a short rest.

background_questions: What did you get caught doing that had you exiled from your home community?
You used to have a different life, but you’ve tried to leave it behind you. Who from that time is still chasing you?
Who from that other life were you most sad to say goodbye to?
connections: What did I recently convince you to do that got us both in trouble?
What have I discovered about your past that I hold secret from the others?
Who do you know from my past, and how have they affected your feelings about me?

class.name: Seraph

create.name: Prayer Dice
create.description: At the beginning of each session, roll a number of d4 dice equal to your Spellcast trait and store them to the right. You can spend one or more of these dice at any time to aid yourself or an ally within Far range. You can use the spent die’s value to reduce any incoming damage or add to any roll result after the roll. Additionally, you can instead exchange the value for that many Hope you can give to any other PC in range. Clear these dice at the end of each session.

create.name: seraph's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope and either reroll a Prayer Die or refresh one of your used Prayer Dice.
You can fly. While flying, you may:
effects: Spend a Hope to pick up and carry another willing creature that is approximately your size or smaller.
Mark a Stress to deal 1d8 additional damage on a successful attack.

create.description: Your supernatural visage strikes awe and fear. While in flight, you have advantage on Presence Rolls, and if that roll is a success with Hope, you can remove a Fear from the GM's Fear Pool instead of gaining Hope.
When you take this mastery, increase your Severe Damage Threshold by +4.
While in flight, your Winged Sentinel Foundation feature deals an extra 1d12 damage instead of 1d8.

create.name: Spirit Weapon
create.description: When you have a Melee weapon equipped, it can fly from your hand to strike an enemy in Close range and return to you. You can mark a Stress to target an additional target in range with the same Attack Roll.

create.name: Sparing Touch
create.description: Once per long rest, use an action and touch a creature to clear 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress from them.

create.name: Devout
create.description: When you roll your prayer dice, you may roll an additional die and drop the lowest option. Additionally, your Sparing Touch feature can now be used one additional time per long rest.

When you roll damage for your Spirit Weapon, if any of your damage dice values match, you can roll an additional damage die for each match. These additional damage dice can’t be used to match and add more dice. For example, if you roll three 5s, add two damage dice to your roll.

background_questions: Who is the god you have devoted yourself to, and in your moment of desperation, what incredible feat did they perform for you that made you indebted to them?
How did your own appearance change after taking your oath?
In what strange or unique way do you communicate with your god?
connections: What promise did you make me agree to, should you die on the battlefield?
Why do you ask me so many questions about my god?
You’ve told me to protect one member of our party above all others, even yourself. Who is it and why?

class.name: Sorcerer

create.name: Arcane Sense
create.description: You can sense the presence of magical people and objects when you’re close to them.

create.name: Minor Illusion
create.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (10). On a success, you create a minor visual illusion no larger than yourself within close Range. This illusion is convincing to anyone in Far range or further.

create.name: Channel Raw Power
create.description: Once per long rest, you can place a Domain card from your Loadout into your Vault and choose to either:
effects: Gain Hope equal to the level of the card.
Enhance a damage-dealing spell by dealing extra magic damage equal to twice the level of the card.
create.appendix: During your next short rest, you can return this card to your hand without paying its recall cost.

create.name: sorcerer's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope after a Spellcast Roll to double the result of your Hope roll.
Your primal origin allows you to modify the essence of magic itself. When you cast a spell or use a weapon that deals magic damage, you can mark a Stress to do one of the following:
effects: Extend its reach by one range.
Add +2 to the action roll result.
Reroll any number of Damage Dice.
Hit an additional target within range.

create.description: You can enhance the magical practices of others with your essence. When you Help an Ally on a Spellcast Roll, the advantage die you roll is a d8 instead of a d6. After you help them make their Spellcast Roll, once per long rest, you can swap the values of their Duality dice.

You can gather magical energy to enhance your capability. You become charged after taking magic damage or when you spend 2 Hope to become charged. When you successfully cast a spell while charged, you can spend your charge to temporarily increase either that spell’s Damage Proficiency by +1 or its Reaction Roll Difficulty by +3. You stop being charged when you finish a long rest.

Your elemental origin lets you manipulate and shape a certain kind of element.
Choose one: WATER · FIRE · AIR · LIGHTNING · EARTH
You can channel this element into unique, harmless effects. Additionally, you can spend a Hope and describe how your control over this element helps an action roll you’re about to make, then add either +2 to the roll or +3 to the damage.

You can call forth your chosen element to protect you from harm. When an attack roll against you succeeds, you can spend a Stress and describe how you channel your element to defend you, then add 1d6 to your Evasion against the attack. If the new Evasion is high enough to avoid the attack, it does.

Once per long rest, you can transform into an elemental form of your chosen element. When you do, describe your transformation and gain two of the following benefits until you finish your next short rest:
effects: +4 to your Severe Threshold
+1 to a character trait
+1 Proficiency
+2 to your Armor Score
+2 Evasion

background_questions: What did you do that made the people in your community wary of you?
What mentor taught you to control your untamed magic, and why are they no longer able to guide you?
You have a deep fear you hide from everyone. What is it, and why does it scare you?
connections: Why do you trust me so deeply?
What did I do that makes you cautious around me?
Why do we keep our shared past a secret?

class.name: Warrior

create.name: Battle Strategist
create.description: After a successful attack roll, you can describe how you outmaneuver your target, then mark a Stress to deal them a Stress.

create.name: Attack of Opportunity
create.description: If an adversary attempts to leave your Melee range, make an Agility reaction roll against their difficulty. Choose one effect on a successful roll, or two on a critical success:
effects: Keep them from moving.
Deal your primary weapon damage.
Move with them.

create.name: Combat Training
create.description: Ignore burden when equipping weapons. Whenever you deal physical damage, add your level to its value.

create.name: warrior's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope to reroll any number of your damage dice on an attack.

On a roll with Hope, you can place a d6 on this card instead of taking a Hope. These are known as your Slayer dice. You can store a number of Slayer dice equal to your Proficiency. When you make an attack roll or damage roll, you can spend any number of these Slayer dice, rolling them and adding their value to your total. At the end of a session, clear any remaining Slayer dice on this card and gain that many Hope.

You can wield multiple weapons with dangerous ease. When you make a successful Attack Roll, you can spend a Hope to add one damage die from your secondary weapon to the damage.
In addition, once per long rest, when you roll your Slayer dice, you can reroll any 1s once, taking the new result.

create.name: Martial Preparation
create.description: You’ve become an inspirational warrior to all who travel with you. You gain access to the Martial Preparation downtime move. To use this during a rest, describe how you instruct and train with your party, then give yourself and each ally a Slayer die, which is a d6. Allies can spend your Slayer die to enhance their own weapon Attack or Damage rolls.

When you fail a roll with Fear, you gain a Hope.
Once per long rest, before you attempt something incredibly dangerous or face off against a foe who clearly outmatches you, describe what ritual you perform or preparation you make, then clear 2 Stress and gain 2 Hope.

You are vigilant in the face of mounting danger.
While you have no more than 2 Hit Point slots unmarked, your Hope die becomes a d20.

Your unbending courage is a rallying point for your allies. You can initiate a Tag Team Roll one extra time per session. Additionally, when an ally initiates a Tag Team Roll with you, they only need to spend 2 Hope to do so.

background_questions: Who taught you to fight, and why did they stay behind when you left home?
Somebody defeated you in battle years ago and left you to die. Who was it, and why did it feel like such a betrayal?
What legendary place have you always wanted to visit, and why is it so special?
connections: We knew each other long before this party came together. How?
What mundane thing off the battlefield do you usually help me with?
What fear am I helping you to overcome?

class.name: Wizard

create.name: A Book You’re Trying to Translate
Prestidigitation
create.description: You can perform harmless, subtle magical effects at will. For example, you might change an object’s color, create a smell, light a candle, cause a tiny object to float, illuminate a room, or repair a small object.

create.name: Strange Patterns
create.description: Choose a number between 1 and 12. Whenever you roll that number on a Duality die, gain a Hope or clear a Stress. You can change this number when you finish a long rest.

create.name: wizard's hope
create.description: Spend three Hope instead of marking your last hit point.

You’ve gained priceless knowledge through great study. You have advantage on all Knowledge Rolls to recall information. If this roll is about the magical nature of a creature or enchantment, gain a Hope even on a roll with Fear.

create.name: Adept
create.description: You can mark a Stress instead of spending a Hope to use an Experience on a roll. If you do, double the Experience modifier for that roll.
When you take this Specialization, you may change an existing Experience you have, then add +1 to one of your Experiences.
Once per short rest, when recalling a Domain card in your vault, you can reduce its Recall Cost by 1.
When you take this Mastery, choose two Experiences and add +1 to each of them.
Whenever you wish to use an Experience, roll a d6. On a result of 5 or 6, you can do so without spending a Hope.
You've focused your studies on shaping magic in dangerous and powerful ways. Gain an extra armor slot.
When you succeed on an Attack Roll with Fear, you deal an extra 1d10 magic damage.

You can concentrate to maintain a protective barrier of magic. While you have at least 2 Hope, you can add your Spellcast trait to your Evasion.
Additionally, the extra magic damage from your School of War Foundation feature increases to 2d10.
When you succeed on an attack roll with Hope, you can choose to make it with Fear instead.
The extra magic damage from your School of War Foundation feature increases to 3d10.

background_questions: What did your community once count on you for? How did you let them down?
You’ve spent your life searching for an object or book of great significance. What is it and why is it so important to you?
You have a powerful rival. Who are they, and why are you so determined to be their end?
connections: What favor have I asked of you that you’re not sure you can fulfill?
What weird hobby or strange fascination do we both share?
What secret about yourself have you entrusted with only me?

features.description: Spend a Hope to take advantage on a roll you make to deceive or trick someone into believing a lie you tell them.

Make a Spellcast Roll against a close target. On a success, you can temporarily keep their attention on you, narrowing their field of view and drowning out any sound but your voice. Once per short rest, you may also mark a Stress on a success to deal a Stress to the target.

You can imbue your speech with enhancing power. At the beginning of a session, place a number of tokens on this card equal to your Presence score. When you recite your words, spend a token and choose an option from the list below to grant to the ally you are speaking to. If the action tracker is active, place that token on it. At the end of a session, clear all tokens.
effects: Clear a Stress
Heal a Hit Point
Gain a Hope

features.name: Power Push
features.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target in melee range. On a success, they are blasted back to far range and take d10+2 magic damage using your proficiency.

features.name: Tava’s Armor
features.description: Use an action to spend a Hope that gives a target you can touch +1d6 to their Armor score the next time they mark an Armor Slot. You can’t stack Tava’s Armor on one creature.

features.name: Ice Spikes
features.description: Make a Spellcast Roll to summon large ice spikes within very far range. If you use them as a weapon, on a success, deal d6 physical damage using your proficiency.

features.name: Slumber
features.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a very close target. On a success, they fall into a deep sleep until they take damage or the GM spends a Fear to awaken them.

features.name: Arcane Barrage
features.description: Once per short rest, use an action to spend any number of Hope and shoot magical projectiles that automatically strike an enemy within close range. Roll an amount of d6 equal to the Hope you spent, and deal that much direct magic damage.

features.name: Telepathy
features.description: You may open a line of mental communication with one target you can see. This connection lasts until you use this spell to connect with another creature.

features.name: Wild Flame
features.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against up to three enemies in melee range of you. A flame erupts from your hand, dealing 2d6 magic damage and a Stress to any you succeed against.

features.name: Magic Hand
features.description: You can reach out with a magical hand the same size and strength as your own to anywhere within far range of you.

features.name: Mysterious Mist
features.description: Use an action to spend a Hope and cast a temporary, thick fog that encircles a stationary area up to very close range your current location. Everyone within is Hidden to anybody outside the fog.

You have a deeply personal trinket that can be infused with protective magic and held as a ward by you or an ally. Describe what it is and why it’s important to you. When the holder of the ward takes damage, they can spend a Hope to reduce it by 1d8. If the ward die rolls an 8, its power will temporarily end after it reduces damage this turn. It can be recharged for free on your next rest.

At the beginning of a session, place a number of tokens equal to your Spellcast Trait on this card.
You can make a Spellcast Roll against a target within far range and spend any number of tokens to channel raw energy from within yourself and unleash against them. On a success, roll a number of d10 equal to the tokens you spent, and do that much magic damage to the target. Mark a Stress to replenish this card with tokens, up to your Spellcast Trait. Clear all tokens at the end of the session.
Spend a Hope to allow a creature you can touch to climb on walls and ceilings as easily as walking on the ground below. This lasts until the end of the scene or when you cast it on another creature.
When you roll your damage dice, you may reroll any 1s or 2s. If you do, you must take the new result, even on a 1 or 2.
When you take damage from a creature in melee range, you may mark a Stress to immediately deal weapon damage to the creature at half Proficiency (rounded up).

Make an Attack Roll against a target using a weapon with melee or very close range. On a success, you may spend a Hope to use that roll against every other enemy in that weapon’s range. Any additional enemies you succeed against with this ability take half damage (rounded up).
You can mark a Stress to move anywhere within far range without making an Agility Roll to get there.
When you are targeted by an attack coming from beyond melee range, mark a Stress to roll a d4 and increase your Evasion against this attack by its value.
While this card is in your loadout, add half of your Agility score to your Evasion (rounded up).
You have advantage on any attempt to pick a non-magical lock, disarm a trap, or steal an item from a target (either through stealth or by force).

Spend a Hope to conjure throwing blades that strike any enemies very close to you. Make a Spellcast Roll and all targets that you succeed against take d8+2 magic damage using your proficiency. If any targets you hit are currently Vulnerable, they take an additional 1d8 magic damage.

When you have a few minutes to prepare, you can mark a Stress to don the facade of any humanoid you can picture clearly in your mind. While disguised, all Presence rolls to avoid scrutiny have advantage.
Place a number of tokens on this card equal to your Spellcast Trait. When you take an action while disguised, spend one. After the action that spends the last token resolves, the disguise drops.

Make a Spellcast Roll to track or ask the GM one question you’d be able to learn about a specific creature or group of creatures based on signs of their passage. If you spend a Hope when you do, take advantage on the roll.
If you encounter any creatures you’ve tracked, your Evasion against them is +1.

You can speak the language of the hidden, natural world. When you want to speak to the plants and animals around you, make an Instinct Roll (12). On a success, they’ll give you the information they know. With Fear, their knowledge might be limited or come at a cost.
In addition, whenever you make a Spellcast Roll while within a natural environment, you may spend a Hope before the roll to add +1 to the result.

Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within far range. On a success, roots and vines reach out from the ground and temporarily Restrain them, dealing 1d8+1 physical damage.
On a success, you may also spend a Hope to temporarily Restrain any enemies very close to your target as well.

Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within far range. On a success, spend a Hope to send a bolt of shimmering light towards them. Treat it like a ranged weapon, dealing d8+2 magic damage using your proficiency and making them glow brightly. They become temporarily Vulnerable.

You lay your hands upon a creature and channel healing magic to help close their wounds. When you can take a few minutes to focus on the person you’re helping, spend 2 Hope and heal a Hit Point or a Stress.
Once per long rest, when you spend this healing time learning something new about them or revealing something about yourself, the 2 Hope you spend heals 2 Hit Points or 2 Stress instead.

Once per short rest, after an ally attempts an Action Roll, but before the consequences take place, you may offer assistance or words of support. When you do, they may reroll their dice. They must accept the result of this new roll.
While this card is in your loadout, if you choose not to equip armor, you have an Armor Score equal to 4 + your Level.

Make an attack with your primary weapon in melee range. On a success, you deal damage, push the target out of melee range and may spend a Hope to also make them temporarily Vulnerable.
On a success with Hope, add an additional 1d6 to your damage dice on this attack.

When an ally very close to you is going to take damage, you may mark a stress to stand in its way and take the damage instead. Reduce the damage by a value equal to your Strength Trait. You may also reduce the damage by spending armor slots.
